College: Rajeshbhaiya Tope College of Pharmacy, Aurangabad
Approval: (PCI) Pharmacy Council of India
Eligiblity: Candidate should be an Indian National and should have passed the HSC (Std.XII) examination of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent examination with subjects English, Physics, Chemistry and Biology /Mathematics AND Secured minimum 45% marks i.e. not less than 135 marks out of 300 marks (minimum 40% marks i.e. not less than 120 marks out of 300 marks in case of candidates of Backward class categories belonging only to Maharashtra State) in the subjects Physics, Chemistry and Biology/Mathematics added together (Maximum of marks obtained in Biology/Mathematics shall be considered for the purpose of addition) AND Obtained a non zero score at MHT-CET 2011. If seat remain vacant after the completion of C.A.P. rounds the non MHT CET 2011 candidates may be considered for institutional level admissions subject to Approval of DTE / Pravesh Niyantran Samiti.Candidate should have passed Diploma course in pharmacy with min. 50% marks from the polytechnics affiliated to MSBTE or AICTE approved autonomous polytechnics in or out side Maharashtra.Eligibility for Direct Admissions in Second Year B.Pharm:The Candidate must be an Indian National and should have passed Post-SSC or Post-HSC Diploma Course in Pharmacy with at least 50.00 % marks (45.00 % marks in case of candidates of Backward class categories belonging only to Maharashtra State) from an AICTE approved Institution with English as the medium of instruction at Diploma level. * The prevailing rules and regulations for admissions by DTE & PNS & University of Pune are mandatary.
Course_Detail: Rajesh Bhaiyya Tope College of Pharmacy (B.Pharm.), Aurangabad offered B.Pharmacy course. B.Pharmacy course is a four year programme and Approved by the AICTE, New Delhi and affiliated to Dr.Babasaheb Ambekar Marathawada University, Aurangabad (M.S.).

Approval: (PCI) Pharmacy Council of India
Eligiblity:
"The candidate seeking admission to Bachelor of Pharmacy (4 Year Degree Course) should be passed 10+2 examination with at least 45% marks and candidate who are belonging to SC/ST/OBC (excluding creamy layer) categories of Madhya Pradesh with at least 40% marks in any equivalent exam with Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics/Biology conducted by M. P. Board of Secondary Education or any other board examination recognized as equivalent by state Govt. of M. P. Minimum qualification for direct admission to second year of B. Pharm. is first division in Diploma In Pharmacy from any institution approved by the Pharmacy Council of India (P.C.I.).
According to Pharmacy Council of India (PCI) candidate who passed 10+2 from open school will not be eligible for admission in Pharmacy"
Course_Detail: Bachelor of Pharmacy is a four year ug programme affiliated to Gandhi Proudyogiki Vishwavidalaya , Bhopal

Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
"The candidate seeking admission to Master of Pharmacy (2 Year Degree Course) should be graduate in pharmacy wirh at least 50% marks. Cadidate who are belonging to SC/ST/OBC (excluding creamy layer) categories of Madhya Pradesh with at least 45% marks. Bachelors degree be of minimum of four years duration should have been obtained from any AICTE approved institution or Indian University or from foreign University recognized by association of Indian Universities (AIU) or institute recognized by the AIU as equivalent thereto.
Candidate in the final year of above degree examinations can also apply on provisional basis. But at the time of counseling, such candidates shall have to produce the original certificate of having passed/mark sheet (showing aggregates marks) of the degree program.
Candidates can apply online and offline for M. Pharm. courses admission and can get admission on the basis of merit list declaration by the authority. Candidate who qualified GPAT get preference for admission."
Course_Detail: Master of Pharmacy-Pharmaceutics is a two year pg programme affiliated to Gandhi Proudyogiki Vishwavidalaya , Bhopal

College: RBVRR Womens College of Pharmacy, Hyderabad
Approval: (PCI) Pharmacy Council of India
Eligiblity:
A candidate for admission must have passed the Intermediate examination of the Andhra Pradesh State Board of Intermediate Education with Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry / Biology as optional subjects or any other examination recognized by the Osmania University as equivalent thereto.
All the eligible applicants will have to pass the Entrance Examination conducted by the Government of Andhra Pradesh. The candidates will be admitted strictly in accordance with the merit secured at the Entrance Examination keeping in view of the rules in force regarding the reservation of seats to various categories of candidates.
Course_Detail: The normal duration of the course is four years. The first academic year comprises of 30 weeks of minimum instructions. Each of the subsequent three academic years is divided into two semesters referred to as the I and II semester in chronological order. Each semester comprises of 15 weeks of minimum instructions.
